sense.def:
Z izrazom
take
povemo, da nekdo izvede neko dejanje. Na primer, kadar nekdo
takes a look at something
, nekaj pogleda.

seg.quote: She took a shower.
He formed the habit of taking long, solitary walks.
Certain decisions had to be taken.
I took a magnificent photo of him.

sense.def:
To take a particular attitude or view
pomeni imeti določeno stališče ali pogled.

seg.quote: The public was beginning to take a positive interest in defence.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
takes a certain amount of time
, potrebujemo določen čas, da tisto naredimo.

seg.quote: How long will it take?
It may take them several weeks to get back.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
takes a particular quality or thing
, človek potrebuje določeno lastnost ali stvar, da lahko tisto izvede.

seg.quote: It took a lot of courage to admit his mistake.

sense.def:
To take something
pomeni dati roko okoli nečesa in tisto držati.

seg.quote: Let me take your coat.
She took the menu from him.

sense.def:
To take something from one place to another
pomeni nekaj odnesti z enega kraja na drugega.

seg.quote: She gave me some books to take home.

sense.def:
To take someone somewhere
pomeni nekoga nekam odpeljati z vozilom ali mu pokazati pot do tja.

seg.quote: It's his turn to take the children to school.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
takes something that belongs to someone else
, nekomu nekaj ukrade.

seg.quote: A pickpocket took Barry's wallet.

sense.def:
Kadar vojaki ali teroristi
take people or places
, zajamejo ljudi ali osvojijo kraj.

seg.quote: We took the village without a shot being fired.

sense.def:
To take office
ali
to take power
pomeni, da nekdo začne izvajati nadzor nad nečem.

seg.quote: He asked me to take charge.

sense.def:
To take something that is offered to someone
pomeni vzeti nekaj, kar je nekomu ponujeno.

seg.quote: She took a job in publishing.

sense.def:
To take someone's advice or orders
pomeni narediti, kakor nam nekdo svetuje ali ukaže.

seg.quote: They have to take instructions from her.

sense.def:
To take pills, medicine, or drugs
pomeni uživati tablete, zdravila ali mamila.

seg.quote: I took a couple of aspirins.

sense.def:
To take a road or route
pomeni potovati do določeni cesti ali poti.

seg.quote: He took the road southwards into the hills.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
cannot take something unpleasant
, ne more zdržati ob nečem neprijetnem.

seg.quote: I can't take any more.
Ordinary people find his arrogance hard to take.

sense.def:
To take an event or piece of news well or badly
pomeni, da se na dogodek ali novico odzovemo dobro ali slabo.

To take what someone says in a particular way
pomeni razložiti si, kar nekdo reče, na določen način.

seg.quote: They took what I said as a kind of rebuke.

sense.def:
To take students for a subject
pomeni sprejemati učence in jih poučevati v nečem.

To take a person's temperature or pulse
pomeni ugotoviti, kakšno temperaturo ali srčni utrip ima nekdo.

To take a particular size in shoes or clothes
pomeni uporabljati čevlje ali oblačila določene številke.

Z izrazom
take
v velelni obliki uvedemo primer, o katerem želimo govoriti.

seg.quote: Some men change the world. Take Albert Einstein, for instance.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
I take it
preverjamo, ali sogovornik nekaj ve ali razume.

seg.quote: I take it you know what a stethoscope is?

sense.def:
To be taken aback
pomeni biti presenečen ali pretresen.

seg.quote: I was a bit taken aback by this sudden reversal.

sense.def:
To take after someone in one's family
pomeni biti podoben ali vesti se podobno kot nekdo od sorodnikov.

cit.quote: biti tak kot, vreči se po kom

seg.quote: You don't take after your sister.

sense.def:
To take something apart
pomeni nekaj razdeliti na sestavne dele.

seg.quote: We encouraged them to explore, invent, take things apart, and put them together.

sense.def:
To take away one number or amount from another
pomeni eno število ali količino odvzeti od druge.

To take something back
pomeni vrniti nekaj.

seg.quote: Don't forget to take your books back to the library.

sense.def:
To take back something that someone said
pomeni, da tista oseba prizna, da je bilo nekaj, kar je rekla, napačno.

seg.quote: I'm going to have to take back all those things I said about you.

sense.def:
To take down a structure
pomeni razstaviti konstrukcijo na dele in jo odstraniti.

seg.quote: The scaffolding won't be taken down until next year.

sense.def:
To take down what someone is saying
pomeni pisati, kar nekdo govori.

seg.quote: She began to take down the message.

sense.def:
To be taken in
pomeni biti ogoljufan.

seg.quote: I wasn't going to be taken in by sentimentality.

sense.def:
To take in information
pomeni razumeti informacijo, ki jo slišimo ali preberemo.

seg.quote: People never take in new facts very easily when they're unhappy.

sense.def:
An aeroplane takes off
, kadar se letalo odlepi od tal in začne leteti.

To take off something
pomeni odstraniti s telesa nekaj, kar imamo oblečeno.

seg.quote: He took off his glasses and blinked.

sense.def:
To take time off
pomeni ne iti na delo.

seg.quote: She's taken the day off.

sense.def:
To take on a job or responsibility
pomeni sprejeti delo ali odgovornost.

seg.quote: She takes on more work than is good for her.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
takes on a new quality
, začne imeti novo lastnost.

seg.quote: His voice took on a new note of uncertainty.

sense.def:
To take someone on
pomeni nekomu dati redno delo.

seg.quote: They took me on because I was a good mathematician.

sense.def:
To take on someone
pomeni bojevati se proti nekomu ali tekmovati z nekom, ki je močnejši od nas.

seg.quote: British Leyland plans to take on the competition at home and abroad.

sense.def:
To take someone out
pomeni peljati nekoga na prijeten kraj in plačati stroške za oba.

seg.quote: He offered to take her out for a meal.

sense.def:
To take one's unhappiness or anger out on someone
pomeni neprijetno se vesti do nekoga, ker smo nesrečni ali jezni, čeprav on ni kriv za to.

seg.quote: She took out most of her unhappiness on her husband.

sense.def:
To take over something
pomeni prevzeti nadzor nad nečem, na primer nad podjetjem ali državo.

seg.quote: The agency tried to take over another company.

sense.def:
To take over a job
ali
to take over
pomeni začeti opravljati delo, ki ga neha delati nekdo drug.

seg.quote: They want me to take over as editor when Harold leaves.

sense.def:
To take to someone or something
pomeni nekoga ali nekaj takoj sprejeti s pozitivnimi čustvi.

seg.quote: We asked him if the Russians would take to golf.

sense.def:
To take to doing something
pomeni začeti nekaj redno delati.

seg.quote: He took to wearing black leather jackets.

sense.def:
To take up an activity or job
pomeni začeti se ukvarjati z neko dejavnostjo ali začeti opravljati neko delo.

seg.quote: I thought I'd take up fishing.
My assistant left to take up another post.

sense.def:
To take up an activity
pomeni nekaj, kar je bilo prekinjeno, nadaljevati od točke, na kateri se je nehalo.

seg.quote: Sam took up the story.

sense.def:
To take up an idea or suggestion
pomeni naprej razpravljati o zamisli ali predlogu.

seg.quote: The committee is expected to take up the question of government grants.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
takes up an amount of time, space, or effort
, je za tisto potreben določen čas, prostor ali napor.

seg.quote: I won't take up any more of your time.

sense.def:
To take someone up on an offer
pomeni sprejeti ponudbo, ki jo je nekdo izrekel.

seg.quote: I didn't expect her to take me up on my invitation so soon.

sense.def:
To take it upon oneself to do something
pomeni nekaj narediti, čeprav to ni naša dolžnost.

seg.quote: She took it upon herself to turn round and say ‘Sh’.
